msDesc.head: 'The Crawford Charters' in Old English and Latin; 10th-15th centuries, with later transcripts and translations

history.provenance: A collection of charters and fragments (several rehoused at the Bodleian under different shelfmarks) perhaps assembled by Robert Austen F. S. A. of Shalford Hall, Surrey (see item IV); at least two items belonged to Thomas Martin of Palgrave (item XXI and MS. Eng. Bib. c. 2, formerly part of the present collection); at least one to Peter le Neve (item XII), one to Charles Mason (item V) and one to Francis Blomefield (item IX). See The Crawford collection of early charters and documents now in the Bodleian library, ed. Arthur S. Napier and William Henry Stevenson (1895), pp. vi-vii (using a different system of numbering for the documents).
W. H. Crawford of Lakelands: his sale, Sotheby's, 14 March 1891, no. 695, sold to Quaritch.
history.acquisition: Purchased by the Bodleian from Quaritch, 14 March 1891. The following items were removed from the volume and rehoused: 51 later English charters, of which 36 related to Surrey and ranged from c. 1230 to 1537; MS. Gr. liturg. c. 2 [=SC 31373], MS. Lat. bib. c. 1 [SC 31375], MS. Lat. liturg. d. 3 [SC 31398], MS. Lat. class. d. 7 [SC 31376], MS. Lat. th. c. 3 [SC 31382], MS. Lat. misc. c. 7 [SC 31380], MS. Eng. bib. c. 2 [SC 31345]. MS. Eng. poet. f. 1 [SC 31360], MS. Fr. b. 1 [SC 31363], and MS. Top. Norf. b. 1 [SC 31413]

recordHist.source: Description adapted (Jan. 2025) from the Summary Catalogue (1924), with additional reference to published literature as cited. Summary Catalogue, Vol. 6, p. 36 Summary Catalogue, Vol. 6, p. 37 Summary Catalogue, Vol. 6, p. 38

availability.p: To ensure its preservation, access to this item is restricted, and readers are asked to work from reproductions and published descriptions as far as possible. If you wish to apply to see the original, please click the request button above. When your request is received, you will be asked to contact the relevant curator outlining the subject of your research, the importance of this item to that research, and the resources you have already consulted.

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item I (fol. 5)

msContents.textLang: Latin, with bounds in Old English

msItem.note: King Aethelheard to Bishop Forthhere; grant of 20 hides at Crediton (Creedy land), Devon, for the foundation of Crediton monastery. 739, 4 Id. April (= April 10) [Manuscript: s. xi 2].

origin.origDate: 11th century, second half (copy of a grant of 739)

listBibl.bibl: The Crawford collection of early charters and documents now in the Bodleian library, ed. Arthur S. Napier and William Henry Stevenson (1895), no. I (pp. 1-3)

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item III (fol. 14)

msItem.note: King Athelstan to Eadulf, Bishop [of Crediton] and the monastery of Crediton; grant of 3 hides at Sandford near Crediton, Devon. 930, III Kal. Maii (= April 29) [Manuscript: s x/xi].
msItem.textLang: Latin, with bounds in Old English

msItem.note: Eadnoth, Bishop [of Crediton], to Beorhtnoth; mortgage of a yardland by the river Creedy, Devon (? Creedy Barton in Newton St Cyres). [c. 1018] [Manuscript: s x/xi].
msItem.textLang: Old English and Latin, with bounds in Old English

origin.origDate: 10th century, late, or 11th century, early (copy of grants of 930 and c. 1018)

listBibl.bibl: The Crawford collection of early charters and documents now in the Bodleian library, ed. Arthur S. Napier and William Henry Stevenson (1895), no. IV (pp. 5-9)

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item IV (fol. 17)

msItem.note: King Edgar to Westminster Abbey [St Peter's, Thorney], confirmation, reciting a bull of Pope John [Pope John XIII], of liberties and of land at Ham (in East Ham), Wennington, Essex; Morden, Surrey; Fanton (Hall) in North Benfleet, Essex; Aldenham, Herts.; Bleccenham and Lothereslege (both lost, in Hendon), Middx; Holwell, Datchworth and Watton-at-Stone, Herts.; Chollington in Eastbourne, Sussex; Staines, with Teddington, Halliford, Feltham and Ashford, Middlesex. 969, Id. Maii (= May 15) [Manuscript: 12th century]

history.provenance: Archive of Westminster Abbey; still at Westminster in 1704 (Napier and Stevenson, p. 89)

listBibl.bibl: The Crawford collection of early charters and documents now in the Bodleian library, ed. Arthur S. Napier and William Henry Stevenson (1895), no. VI (pp. 12-18)
The Electronic Sawer: Online Catalogue of Anglo-Saxon Charters, no. 774

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item V (fol. 20)

msItem.note: King Eadwig to Archbishop Oda [of Canterbury]; grant of 40 hides at Ely ('Helig'). 957, VII Id. Maii (= May 9) [Manuscript: s x med].

origin.origDate: 10th century, middle (grant of 957, possibly an original)

history.provenance: Dr. Charles Mason, Rector of Orwell, Cambridgeshire (d. 1771) (Napier and Stevenson, p. 80)

msItem.note: King Ethelred to Ealdorman Leofwine; grant of 7 1/2 hides of land, forfeited by Wistan for murder, at Southam (3 hides), Ladbroke and Radbourne (4 1/2 hides), Warwicks. 998 [Manuscript: s. x ex].
msItem.textLang: Old English and Latin, with bounds in Old English

origin.origDate: 10th century, late (grant of 998, possibly an original)

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item VII (fol. 26)

msContents.textLang: Latin, with bounds in Old English

msItem.note: King Ethelred to St Albans Abbey; grant of land at Norton, 'Rodanhangra' and Oxhey, Herts., originally granted to the abbey by King Offa but subsequently lost, and later forfeited to King Ethelred by Ealdorman Leofsige, and purchased for St Albans by Archbishop Aelfric and Abbot Leofric. 1007

msItem.note: King Cnut to Christ Church, Canterbury; grant of the port of Sandwich. (Fol. 30 is an 18th-century Latin translation.) 1023 [Manuscript: s. xi/xii].

origin.origDate: 11th century, late, or 12th century, early (copy of a grant of 1023)

listBibl.bibl: The Crawford collection of early charters and documents now in the Bodleian library, ed. Arthur S. Napier and William Henry Stevenson (1895), no. XII (pp. 27-29)

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item IX (fol. 34)

msItem.note: Bartholomew de Glanville; confirmation of his father's grants to the priory of Bromholm, Norfolk, listing the lands of Stanard, the priest of Keswick, with the church, the churches of Broomholm, Dilham, and Paston, and tithes of several neighbouring estates (see 'Houses of Cluniac monks: The priory of Bromholm', in A History of the County of Norfolk: Volume 2, ed. William Page (London, 1906), pp. 359-363). [c. 1150]

listBibl.bibl: The Crawford collection of early charters and documents now in the Bodleian library, ed. Arthur S. Napier and William Henry Stevenson (1895), no. XVI (pp. 32-33)

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item X (fol. 37)

msItem.note: William [de Albini], earl of Chichester to the church of Burton Lazars; grant of 120 acres in Wymondham, Norfolk. [c. 1150]

listBibl.bibl: The Crawford collection of early charters and documents now in the Bodleian library, ed. Arthur S. Napier and William Henry Stevenson (1895), no. XIV (p. 31)

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item XI (fol. 38)

msItem.note: Nigel de Moubrai to the canons of St Mary's, Southwark; grant of an orchard,etc., at Banstead, Surrey. [c. 1150]

listBibl.bibl: The Crawford collection of early charters and documents now in the Bodleian library, ed. Arthur S. Napier and William Henry Stevenson (1895), no. XV (p. 32)

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item XII (fol. 41)

msItem.note: Will of Leofwine, son of Wulfstan, including bequests of land at Kelvedon and Markshall, Essex, to Westminster Abbey [St Peter's Westminster], and at Purleigh, Essex, partly to God's servants at Notley, Essex, and partly to Leofwaru, his aunt; and at Barling, Essex, to Wulfstan, bishop (of London). 998, XVII Kal. Maii (= April 15) [manuscript: 11th century]
Item XVI (fol. 51) is an 18th-century (?) copy and item XVII (fols. 55-54) is an 17th-century (?) Latin translation.)

history.provenance: Archive of Westminster Abbey; still there in 1702 when printed by Thomas Madox, Formulare Anglicanum (1702), no. DCCLXVI
Peter le Neve, 1727 (his endorsement of price and date of purchase).

listBibl.bibl: The Crawford collection of early charters and documents now in the Bodleian library, ed. Arthur S. Napier and William Henry Stevenson (1895), no. IX (p. 22)
The Electronic Sawer: Online Catalogue of Anglo-Saxon Charters, no. 1522

msItem.note: Will of Alfwold, Bishop [of Crediton], including bequests of land at Sandford, Devon, to the monastery at Crediton and to Godric. [1008 × 1012] [manuscript: 11th century, first half]

origin.origDate: 11th century, first half (copy of a will of 1008 × 1012]

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item XIV (fol. 45)

msItem.note: Archbishop [Dunstan] to King Ethelred; letter concerning belonging to the diocese of Cornwall including Pawton in St Breock, 'Cællwic' (tentatively identified as Callington), and Lawhitton, Cornwall. [981 × 988] [Manuscript: s. x ex].

origin.origDate: 10th century, late (grant of 981 × 988, possibly an original)

history.provenance: Archive of Exeter Cathedral (from Crediton and perhaps St Germans)

listBibl.bibl: The Crawford collection of early charters and documents now in the Bodleian library, ed. Arthur S. Napier and William Henry Stevenson (1895), no. VII (pp. 18-19)
The Electronic Sawer: Online Catalogue of Anglo-Saxon Charters, no. 1296

msItem.note: William of Warelwast, Bishop of Exeter; confirmation to the canons of Crediton of their liberties. [1107 × 1137]

listBibl.bibl: English episcopal acta. 11, Exeter, 1046-1184, ed. F. Barlow (1996), no. 15
The Crawford collection of early charters and documents now in the Bodleian library, ed. Arthur S. Napier and William Henry Stevenson (1895), no. XIII (pp. 29-31)

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item XVI (fol. 51)

msItem.note: Transcript of XII above.

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item XVII (fols. 54-5)

msItem.note: Translation of XII above into Latin

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item XVIII (fol. 56)

msItem.note: 18th-century English translation of Sawyer 1487, the will (975 × 1016) of Ælfhelm (Polga), including bequests of land at Wratting, Cambs., to Ely Abbey; at Brickendon, Herts., to Westminster Abbey; at Whepstead, Suffolk, and Walton (perhaps near Felixstowe, Suffolk), to his son Ælfgar; and at Baddow and Burstead, Essex, at Stratford, (probably Stratford St Mary, Suffolk), at Enhale and Wilbraham, Cambs., at Rayne, Essex, at Carlton, Cambs., and at Gestingthorpe, Essex, to his wife; at Gestingthorpe, Essex, to Godric and Ælfhelm's daughter; at Conington, Cambs., to his wife and daughter, and to Æthelric, Ælfwold and Osmær; also at Cockayne Hatley and Potton, Beds., to Ælfmær, Ælfstan and Osgar; at Littlebury (near Saffron Walden), Essex, to Leofsige, and at Great Staughton, Hunts., to Leofsige and his wife; also at Troston, Suffolk, to his three brothers and Ælfwold; at Ickleton, Cambs., and Mawyrthe to Ælfhelm; and at Barnham (probably Suffolk), to Wulfmær. Not printed by Napier and Stevenson.

listBibl.bibl: The Electronic Sawer: Online Catalogue of Anglo-Saxon Charters, no. 1487

altIdentifier.idno: MS. Eng. hist. a. 2, item XXI (fol. 65)

msItem.note: Ralph Lestrange to St Katherine's Blackburgh; grant of land in Wormegay, Norfolk. [c. 1150]
